Rulers of Sadiya

The Sutiya (or Chutiya) dynasty was a powerful kingdom in medieval Assam, founded in 1187 CE by Birpal. They ruled vast areas of eastern Assam and Arunachal Pradesh around their capital Sadiya (Swarnagiri). This dynasty was known for its syncretic Indo-Tibetan culture and worship of Shakti (Shaktism), particularly at the Tamresvari Temple (Kechaikhati).

ЁЯП╣
Conflict and Merger

The Sutiya kingdom was one of the main rivals of the Ahoms. The struggle for supremacy between the two lasted for centuries. Finally, in 1523, the Ahom king Suhungmung defeated the Sutiya king Nitipal and annexed the kingdom. However, Sutiya nobles and people were integrated into the Ahom administration, and the Ahoms also learned the knowledge of gunpowder and artillery from the Sutiya.
